alert.note: Alert for Quay County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 24 at 2:34AM MST until November 24 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 5 inches. Higher amounts near 6 inches likely across far southern and western portions of the county. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Quay County. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 11 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-40, especially from Tucumcari westward.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.
